title.native: かぐや様は告らせたい？～天才たちの恋愛頭脳戦～
title.romaji: Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai?: Tensaitachi no Renai Zunousen

description:
After a slow but eventful summer vacation, Shuchiin Academy's second term is now starting in full force. As August transitions into September, Miyuki Shirogane's birthday looms ever closer, leaving Kaguya Shinomiya in a serious predicament as to how to celebrate it. Furthermore, the tenure of the school's 67th student council is coming to an end. Due to the council members being in different classes, the only time Kaguya and Miyuki have to be together will soon disappear, putting all of their cunning plans at risk.

A long and difficult election that will decide the fate of the new student council awaits, as multiple challengers fight for the coveted title of president.
synonyms: Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai: Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen 2
辉夜大小姐想让我告白～天才们的恋爱头脑战～第二季
辉夜大小姐想让我告白～天才们的恋爱头脑战～ 2
Kaguya-sama wa Kokurasetai?: Tensai-tachi no Renai Zunousen
สารภาพรักกับคุณคางุยะซะดีๆ ~สงครามประสาทความรักของเหล่าอัจฉริยะ~ ภาค 2
Госпожа Кагуя: в любви как на войне. 2 сезон

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Villainess
tags.description: Centers around or prominently features a villainous noble lady.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

name.native: アドルフ・ペスカローロ

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akasaka_aka) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=3127667)

Illustrator for Vocaloid's [IA](https://anilist.co/character/187466/IA) and ONE. Aka Akasaka got his start as an assistant to [Jinsei Kataoka](https://anilist.co/staff/97888/Jinsei-Kataoka) and [Kazuma Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/97887/Kazuma-Kondou), the creators of Deadman Wonderland. His first serialized manga was an adaptation of the light novel series Sayonara Piano Sonata, published by Kadokawa in 2011. Kaguya-sama: Love Is War began serialization in Miracle Jump in 2015 but was later moved to Weekly Young Jump in 2016 due to its popularity.

In a Tweet on November 3, 2022, he announced his retirement from drawing manga. He will continue to work on authoring his current/future works.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/290765011) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=3782618)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/羽岡佳)
_Note: Not to be confused with the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/256771/)._
Shinichi Omata is a Japanese director, storyboard artist, and former producer best known for directing Showa Genroku Rakugo Shinju (2016) and Kaguya-sama: Love is War (2019).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/118328356)

Previously affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures), he is now affiliated with [CygamesPictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6182/CygamesPictures).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dakenmukuinugam)
Affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/).
Rie Matsubara does editing.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ff2stzbtlxhtjm0)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
Affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures).
Affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ksss_yk)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1150290132)

[Website](https://www.martin.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/martin40_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUo8fGx9iLwNhpA0_XSPvfw) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/7HRu4Npbza5TBWn74TkAOF)

A Japanese singer who was born in Ota, Tokyo. He was a member of the Japanese band Rats & Star. He is also called Japan's King Of Love Songs.

**Place of Birth:** Gifu Prefecture, Japan

[Website](http://airisuzuki-officialweb.com/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/airisuzuki-officialblog) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/airimania) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/airisuzuki_official_uf/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRkCifCbAw0qwu7XzOa9d7w)


Airi Suzuki is a Japanese singer, actress, model, and radio personality associated with Up-Front Works. In 2002, she joined Hello! Project as a member of Hello! Project Kids and later debuted as the lead vocalist of the idol girl group Cute in 2005. Throughout her singing career, Suzuki also became a vocalist for the girl group Buono! From June 2015 onwards, she became an exclusive model for the fashion magazine Ray.

After Cute and Buono! disbanded in 2017, Suzuki left Hello! Project and debuted as a solo singer with the album Do Me a Favor, with "Distance" as its lead track.

In 2020, Suzuki debuted in the anime industry by performing the opening theme for the second season of [Kaguya-sama: Love is War](https://anilist.co/anime/112641/) alongside [Masayuki Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/137938/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

__[Website](https://fukuharaharuka-music.com/) | [Actress Profile (Ken-on)](https://www.ken-on.co.jp/haruka/) | [Artist Profile (Ken-on)](https://www.ken-on.co.jp/artists/fukuhara-voice-actor/) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/roomharuka) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/haruka_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/haruka.f.official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0aQ827BDrHcDSNaM1_qaxA)__

__Haruka Fukuhara__ is a Japanese voice actress, artist, vocalist and model.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/81658029) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akimitsuhomma/) | [Website](https://akimitsuhomma.com/)

He was part of the music group [Vink](https://anilist.co/staff/228057/).

Graduated: Hitotsubashi University (Faculty of Sociology)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mizunoyoshiki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/水野良樹)

Leader and member of the band [Ikimono-gakari](https://anilist.co/staff/102277).

Graduated: Hitotsubashi University (Faculty of Sociology)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mizunoyoshiki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/水野良樹)

Leader and member of the band [Ikimono-gakari](https://anilist.co/staff/102277).

__[Profile (Sony Music Publishing)](https://smpj.jp/songwriters/shinquoogura/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ogura_shinquo)__

__Birthplace:__ Tatebayashi City, Gunma Prefecture, Japan
__Hometown:__ Isesaki City, Gunma Prefecture, Japan

__Shinkou Ogura__, stylized as Shinquo Ogura, is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, track maker and sound producer. His favorite instrument to play is the piano, but he is proficient with most instruments.

__[Blog (Livedoor)](http://blog.livedoor.jp/aratata)__

__Birthplace:__ Hiroshima Prefecture, Japan

__Arata Umehara__ is a Japanese guitarist, composer and arranger.
